captions.text: Hey boss.  I just got these pictures, and guess who's hanging out with the enemy.
I'm for reals a bad guy now.
Yeah, it's really not worth the risk.
Plus I'm like SUPER EVIL, so...
Now you stay dead this time!
Um, guys!  We gotta come up with a better plan.
I'm sorry!  Did somebody just say a tank?!
Plan B?!  We need a plan C, D, E...
Hey we do what we do best, alright!
What's going on!?  What are they doing?
They're driving really fast and furious, sir!
Fast cars? Are they at least weaponized some how?  Like with a tank missile or something?
Well they had this harpoon gun it looks like, but other than that...
I think it's just really, fancy fast cars.
Oh my gosh.  We are IN a TANK!
Oh you were taken from this world too soon...
You wanna go have a picnic with my family?
I can't believe we made it out of there alive!
It's because I'm Han Solo, baby!
Plus, I can't die til Tokyo Drift!
Ladies and gentlemen, this is your captain speaking.  We have touched down on the worlds longest runway ever in history and are begining our final final approach to our destination.
Now would be a good time to click that subscribe button
We also have several other in flight, How It Should Have Endeds for you to choose from
so please feel free to watch more videos while you wait.
Again, I apologize for the inconvience.
I did not make this runway.
I probably could have just landed closer to the airport, however.

comments.text:
+TMFlesh
Of course i'm joking, F&F at least the last couple of movies has gotten 
lazy instead of beyond immpossible not at all belivable stunts and not 
getting hurt by bullets missiles ect. they should have put them do smth 
smarter and original that would require nerves of steel not breaking so 
blatanly the rules of physics because in the end they are not agents 
trained by the greatest teachers in the world(they are not Batman) but a 
bunch of street racers the best maybe but street racers none the less.
comments.author: Raximus3000

comments.text:
+Raximus3000
You're joking right? I mean that's the point, in CERTAIN media and films 
that kind of thing is acceptable. This is because the premise has already 
set the expectations of what is and isn't possible. For example you 
wouldn't complain about nonexistent technology in a scifi or futuristic 
setting but you start shooting of lasers in old school western or in a film 
noir detective drama then you have a problem. If the premise for super 
human ability and impossible stunts aren't set before hand then it just 
becomes a jarring experience that breaks immersion.
comments.author: TMFlesh

comments.text:
+TMFlesh
Big deal even little girls can shoot beams out of their eyes (in certain 
media) and flying isn't realy that much.
